perturbation.original_text:
1. The Term of the Agreement is hereby extended to January 20, 2012 unless sooner terminated as provided for in the Agreement. If the Agreement
expired prior to the Amendment Effective Date, any orders received and Products and Services purchased between the date of expiration and the
Amendment Effective Date shall be in all respects deemed made under the Agreement as in effect prior to this Amendment. The parties further
agree that if Distributor places Purchase Orders after the expiration of the Agreement, and Cisco accepts such Purchase Orders, then any such
Purchase Orders shall be governed by the terms and conditions of the Agreement; provided, however that acceptance by Cisco of any Purchase
Order placed after the Agreement has expired will not be considered as an extension of the term of the Agreement nor a renewal thereof.
Notwithstanding Cisco’s right to extend the term of the Agreement, each party acknowledges that the Agreement shall always be interpreted as
being limited in duration to a definite term and that the other party has made no commitments whatsoever regarding the renewal of the Agreement
beyond those expressly agreed in writing.
perturbation.changed_text:
1. The Term of the Agreement is hereby extended to January 20, 2012 unless sooner terminated as provided for in the Agreement. If the Agreement
expired prior to the Amendment Effective Date, any orders received and Products and Services purchased between the date of expiration and the
Amendment Effective Date shall be in all respects deemed made under the Agreement as in effect prior to this Amendment. The parties further
agree that if Distributor places Purchase Orders after the expiration of the Agreement, and Cisco accepts such Purchase Orders, then any such
Purchase Orders shall be governed by the terms and conditions of the Agreement; provided, however that acceptance by Cisco of any Purchase
Order placed after the Agreement has expired will be considered as an automatic extension of the term of the Agreement and a renewal thereof.
Notwithstanding Cisco’s right to extend the term of the Agreement, each party acknowledges that the Agreement shall always be interpreted as
being limited in duration to a definite term and that the other party has made no commitments whatsoever regarding the renewal of the Agreement
beyond those expressly agreed in writing.
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly states that accepting purchase orders after the agreement expires does *not* constitute a renewal or extension. The modified text contradicts this by stating that such acceptance *does* constitute an automatic extension and renewal. This creates uncertainty about the term of the agreement and under what conditions it can be extended.

perturbation.original_text:
12.1 Distributor shall have the option to return to Cisco, for credit, up [*****] of the dollar value of Products from the Wholesale Price List (or, if
no Wholesale Price Lists exists for Distributor's Territory, then the applicable price list)
shipped to Distributor, net of credits, less returns to Cisco, in the preceding [*****] period (the "Balancing Cap") of the
preceding Cisco fiscal quarter. The above-referenced cap shall be determined based on all Product purchases made under
this Agreement. The responsibility to manage the Balancing Cap shall rest solely upon Distributor. Distributor shall be
entitled to return Product once per quarter, provided such returns do not exceed the Balancing Cap. "Dead on Arrival"
and Obsolete Products returned pursuant to Section 13 of this Agreement shall be excluded from calculation of the
Balancing Cap. Cisco shall credit Distributor's account in the amount of the price paid by Distributor therefore, less any
price protection credits issued to Distributor related to the Product returned (the "Return Credit").
perturbation.changed_text:
12.1 Distributor may, at Cisco's sole discretion, return to Cisco, for credit, up [*****] of the dollar value of Products from the Wholesale Price List (or, if
no Wholesale Price Lists exists for Distributor's Territory, then the applicable price list)
shipped to Distributor, net of credits, less returns to Cisco, in the preceding [*****] period (the "Balancing Cap") of the
preceding Cisco fiscal quarter. The above-referenced cap shall be determined based on all Product purchases made under
this Agreement. The responsibility to manage the Balancing Cap shall rest solely upon Cisco. Distributor shall be
entitled to return Product once per quarter, provided such returns do not exceed the Balancing Cap. "Dead on Arrival"
and Obsolete Products returned pursuant to Section 13 of this Agreement shall be included in calculation of the
Balancing Cap. Cisco shall credit Distributor's account in the amount of the price determined by Cisco, less any
price protection credits issued to Distributor related to the Product returned (the "Return Credit").
perturbation.explanation: The original text says that the distributor has the *option* to return products. The modified text says that the distributor *may* return products, but this is at *Cisco's* discretion. Also the original text mentions that the distributor has the sole responsibility to manage balancing cap while the modified text mentions it is on Cisco. The original text states DOA and obsolete Products are excluded from calculation while modified text states they are included. Lastly, it changes how the amount of credit is calculated.

perturbation.original_text:
4.0 Section 21.0 ("Compliance with Laws") is hereby deleted in its entirety and replaced with the following:
21.0 COMPLIANCE WITH LAWS, INCLUDING ANTI-CORRUPTIONLAWS
21.1 In connection with the sale or distribution of Cisco Products or Services, or otherwise in carrying out its obligations under this Agreement,
Distributor represents and warrants the following:
(a) Distributor will comply with all country, federal, state and local laws, ordinances, codes, regulations, rules, policies and procedures, Including,
without limitation, all anti-corruption laws, Including, the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (Applicable Laws). Distributor can find more
information about the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act at the following URL: http://www.usdoj.gov/criminal/fraud/docs/dojdocb.html, or by
contacting publicsectorcompllance@cisco.com.
(b) Distributor shall not take any action or permit or authorize any action in violation of the Applicable Laws;
perturbation.changed_text:
4.0 Section 21.0 ("Compliance with Laws") is hereby deleted in its entirety and replaced with the following:
21.0 COMPLIANCE WITH LAWS, INCLUDING ANTI-CORRUPTIONLAWS
21.1 In connection with the sale or distribution of Cisco Products or Services, or otherwise in carrying out its obligations under this Agreement,
Distributor represents and warrants the following:
(a) Distributor will use its best efforts to comply with all country, federal, state and local laws, ordinances, codes, regulations, rules, policies and procedures, Including,
without limitation, all anti-corruption laws, Including, the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (Applicable Laws). Distributor can find more
information about the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act at the following URL: http://www.usdoj.gov/criminal/fraud/docs/dojdocb.html, or by
contacting publicsectorcompllance@cisco.com.
(b) Distributor may take action or permit or authorize any action in violation of the Applicable Laws;
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the distributor *will* comply with all applicable laws, which is an absolute requirement. The modified text weakens this to "use its best efforts to comply" and the Distributor shall not take any action in violation of Applicable laws to Distributor *may* take action. This creates uncertainty about the distributor's obligation to comply with laws, as "best efforts" is a vague term and Distributor *may* take actions to authorize violation of Applicable Laws.
